title: Database for Developing Transitivity Methodology in Network Meta-Analysis
text: tracenma R package contains database extracted aggregate study-level characteristics (may act effect modifiers) 217 systematic reviews network meta-analysis published 2004 2015. tracenma also contains functions access catalogue available systematic reviews datasets extracted characteristics, comprising database. package built upon R package nmadb (version 1.2.0) define eligible connected networks extract available characteristics corresponding systematic reviews. Currently, tracenma includes subset systematic reviews available nmadb. ðŸ‘‰ tracenma R package used develop appraise methodology assess transitivity assumption quantitatively. ðŸ‘Ž tracenma R package used, instance, map characteristics reported specific healthcare fields database.

what: Access the index of specific dataset(s)
title: Database for Developing Transitivity Methodology in Network Meta-Analysis
text: Use function get.dataset.index get one systematic reviews characteristics. instance, let us access available systematic reviews publish 2007 using default arguments: Add argument show.title = TRUE access article titles. Add argument show.comment = TRUE activate extraction-related comments accompanying articles. default arguments FALSE (report). Now, let us access systematic reviews PMID numbers 16951908 17932160:
code: get.dataset.index(pmid = NULL, year = 2007) #>    nmadb.ID     PMID  First.Author Year          Journal.Name   Outcome.Type #> 11   480655 16951908   Vestergaard 2007        Osteoporos Int      Objective #> 14   501355 17478472         Nixon 2007          Rheumatology     Subjective #> 13   501336 17651658        McLeod 2007 Health Technol Assess     Subjective #> 15   501395 17903393 Soares-Weiser 2007 Health Technol Assess Semi-objective #> 12   501309 17932160           Lam 2007                   BMJ      Objective                                                                                                                                                      #>    Intervention.Comparison.Type Includes.ToC.where                      Source.ToC #> 11   pharmacological vs placebo          Main text                         Table 1 #> 14   pharmacological vs placebo          Main text                         Table 1 #> 13   pharmacological vs placebo          Main text                    Table 2 to 4 #> 15   pharmacological vs placebo          Both      Tables 1 & 2, Appendix Tables 5 #> 12   non-pharmacological vs any          Main text                         Table 1 get.dataset.index(pmid = c(16951908, 17932160)) #>    nmadb.ID     PMID  First.Author Year    Journal.Name  Outcome.Type #> 11   480655 16951908   Vestergaard 2007  Osteoporos Int     Objective #> 12   501309 17932160           Lam 2007             BMJ     Objective                                                                                                                                                      #>    Intervention.Comparison.Type Includes.ToC.where Source.ToC #> 11   pharmacological vs placebo          Main text    Table 1 #> 12   non-pharmacological vs any          Main text    Table 1

title: Database for Developing Transitivity Methodology in Network Meta-Analysis
text: Use function get.dataset get dataset extracted characteristics specific systematic review. instance, let us access dataset systematic review PMID number 16951908 using default arguments: Adding argument show.index = TRUE returns additional dataframe, $Characteristics_index (following dataset, skipped example ) abbreviation (left column) full name (right column) characteristic: Lastly, adding argument show.type = TRUE enhances additional dataframe, $Characteristics_index, another two columns appearing right; Characteristic.type (clinical, demographic, methodological) Characteristic.subtype (participant, treatment, outcome, age, sex, ethnicity, study design, study setting, risk bias, withdrawals) characteristic: default arguments FALSE (report). â€™s moment! ðŸ˜Ž â˜•
code: get.dataset(pmid = 16951908) #> # A tibble: 25 Ã— 12 #>    `trial (reference)`   treat1 treat2    arm1    arm2    sex sample.size h.rPTH   calcium vitamin.D duration quality #>    <chr>                  <dbl>  <dbl>   <chr>   <chr>  <chr>       <dbl>  <chr>     <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>   <dbl> #>  1 Finkelstein 1998 (26)      1      2 control  PTH 40 female          43   1-34        NA        NA       12       2 #>  2 Lane 1998 (42)             1      3 control  PTH 25 female          51   1-34      1500       800       12       3 #>  3 Kurland 2000 (33)          1      4 control  PTH 32   male          23   1-34      1500       400       18       3 #>  4 Cosman 2001 (24)           1      3 control  PTH 25 female          52   1-34      1500       800       36       3 #>  5 Neer 2001 (5)              1      2 control  PTH 40 female         882   1-34      1000       400       21       3 #>  6 Neer 2001 (5)              1      5 control  PTH 20 female         892   1-34      1000       400       21       3 #>  7 Neer 2001 (5)              2      5  PTH 40  PTH 20 female         878   1-34      1000       400       21       3 #>  8 Body 2002 (43)             1      2 control  PTH 40 female         146   1-34      1000       400       12       4 #>  9 Finkelstein 2003 (28)      1      2 control  PTH 40   male          48   1-34      1000       400       30       3 #> 10 Finkelstein 2003 (28)      1      6 control PTH+ALN   male          53   1-34      1000       400       30       3 #> # â„¹ 15 more rows #> # â„¹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows get.dataset(pmid = 16951908, show.index = TRUE) #> $Characteristics_index #> # A tibble: 7 Ã— 2 #>   Abbreviation Full.name                               #>   <chr>        <chr>                                   #> 1 sex          sex                                     #> 2 sample.size  sample size                             #> 3 h.rPTH       human (recombinant) parathyroid hormone #> 4 calcium      calcium in mg/day                       #> 5 vitamin.D    vitamin D in IU/day                     #> 6 duration     trial duration in months                #> 7 quality      study quality get.dataset(pmid = 16951908, show.index = TRUE, show.type = TRUE) $Characteristics_index #> # A tibble: 7 Ã— 4 #>   Abbreviation Full.name                               Characteristic.type Characteristic.subtype #>   <chr>        <chr>                                   <chr>               <chr>                  #> 1 sex          sex                                     Demographic         Sex                    #> 2 sample.size  sample size                             Methodological      Study design           #> 3 h.rPTH       human (recombinant) parathyroid hormone Clinical            Intervention           #> 4 calcium      calcium in mg/day                       Clinical            Intervention           #> 5 vitamin.D    vitamin D in IU/day                     Clinical            Intervention           #> 6 duration     trial duration in months                Methodological      Study design           #> 7 quality      study quality                           Methodological      Risk of bias

what: Get the selected dataset â€” get.dataset
title: Get the selected dataset â€” get.dataset
text: Retrieving dataset study-level aggregate clinical methodological characteristics (may act effect modifiers) extracted selected systematic review database.

title: Get the selected dataset â€” get.dataset
Get the selected dataset â€” get.dataset
text: pmid scalar PMID number systematic review found database. show.index Logical indicate whether return data-frame full name abbreviated characteristics. default FALSE (report). show.type Logical indicate whether return data-frame type (Demographic, Clinical, Methodological) subtype (Age, Ethnicity, Intervention, Outcome, Participant, Risk bias, Sex, Study design, Study setting, Withdrawals) characteristics. default FALSE (report).

title: Get the selected dataset â€” get.dataset
text: get.dataset returns following: Dataset data-frame (tibble style) rows referring   studies columns study-level aggregate characteristics   extracted report corresponding systematic review. Characteristics_index data-frame (tibble style) rows   referring extracted characteristics (abbreviated name) columns   full name (show.index = TRUE), type   subtype (show.type = TRUE).

title: Get the selected dataset â€” get.dataset
text: selected dataset refers connected network specific outcome studied corresponding systematic review. R package nmadb used retrieve corresponding dataset. Specifically, function readByID employed download dataset long format. , function pairwise R package netmeta implemented convert dataset wide format row repeated many times number possible comparisons made corresponding study. study names (references) treatment comparisons, returned readByID, used locate studies corresponding report systematic review (Appendix, available) extract characteristics available relevant table(s). characteristic occupies one column dataset. Characteristics pertaining intervention features occupied one column experimental another control treatment corresponding comparison.

what: Get the index of specific dataset(s) â€” get.dataset.index
title: Get the index of specific dataset(s) â€” get.dataset.index
text: Retrieving characteristics one systematic reviews found database using PMID number year publication.

title: Get the index of specific dataset(s) â€” get.dataset.index
code: get.dataset.index(pmid, year = NULL, show.title = FALSE, show.comment = FALSE)

title: Get the index of specific dataset(s) â€” get.dataset.index
text: pmid scalar vector PMID number(s) systematic reviews found database. year scalar define year publication. get.dataset.index return systematic reviews found database year. show.title Logical indicate whether show title selected systematic review(s). default FALSE (show). show.comment Logical indicate whether show comment referring extraction notes selected systematic review(s). default FALSE (show).

title: Get the index of specific dataset(s) â€” get.dataset.index
text: get.dataset.index returns vector (pmid scalar) data-frame (pmid vector) following characteristics (column names): nmadb.ID ID number provided R package   nmadb. PMID PMID number. First.Author name first author. Year year publication. Journal.Name abbreviated name journal. Title title systematic review. Outcome.Type outcome type suggested Turner et al.   (2012) distinguished objective, semi-objective subjective. Intervention.Comparison.Type treatment-comparator type   suggested Turner et al. (2012) distinguished   pharmacological versus placebo, pharmacological versus pharmacological,   non-pharmacological versus . Includes.ToC.Whether extracted study-level   aggregate characteristics found main article, Appendix   . Source.ToC exact location systematic review   extracted study-level aggregate characteristics found,   Table(s) main article, / Appendix. Comment Notes related extraction selected systematic   review(s).

title: Get the index of specific dataset(s) â€” get.dataset.index
text: year specified, argument pmid NULL. , get.dataset.index returns systematic reviews found database year. Except PMID, Includes.ToC., Source.ToC, characteristics retrieved R package nmadb using function getNMADB subsetting systematic reviews available data (.e., Data.available == "True" using function getNMADB). database reduced extraction, instance, due reporting issues data unavailability systematic review relating extraction process.

what: tracenma: Database for Developing Transitivity Methodology in Network Meta-Analysis â€” tracenma-package
title: tracenma: Database for Developing Transitivity Methodology in Network Meta-Analysis â€” tracenma-package
text: database extracted study-level aggregate characteristics (may act effect modifiers) 217 systematic reviews network meta-analysis set functions facilitate access. database aimed methodology development appraisal assess transitivity assumption quantitatively.

title: tracenma: Database for Developing Transitivity Methodology in Network Meta-Analysis â€” tracenma-package
text: R-package tracenma built upon R-package nmadb (version 1.2.0) using provided database define set connected networks extract available study-level aggregate clinical methodological characteristics (may act effect modifiers) corresponding systematic reviews. database tracenma currently includes subset systematic reviews available nmadb; included systematic reviews published 2004 2015 available data characteristics extraction. tracenma comprises functions access catalogue available systematic reviews network meta-analysis datasets extracted characteristics. tracenma used purpose developing appraising methodology assess transitivity assumption quantitatively. tracenma used context empirical-like study, instance, map characteristics reported specific healthcare fields, content completeness extracted characteristics tracenma strongly depend reporting quality completeness considered systematic reviews, well knowledge involved authors regarding investigated research field. latter also requires authors systematic reviews familiar notion effect modification. Therefore, extracted characteristics may comprise complete set necessary effect modifiers various investigated research fields. Furthermore, included systematic reviews reported characteristics inconsistently across studies. achieve consistent format, proceeded transformations using 1) statistical methods Wan et al. (2014) developed evaluated quantitative characteristics 2) subjective judgments qualitative characteristics. Therefore, accuracy extracted data may compromised extent. Type citation("tracenma") cite tracenma. report possible bugs errors, send email Loukia Spineli (Spineli.Loukia@mh-hannove.de). development version tracenma available GitHub GPL-3.0 License.

title: tracenma: Database for Developing Transitivity Methodology in Network Meta-Analysis â€” tracenma-package

Estimating sample mean standard deviation sample size, median, range /interquartile range. BMC Med Res Methodol 2014;14:1--13. doi:10.1186/1471-2288-14-135
